result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan Samuel Alloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be collected through the Clerk of Court's Office. A six month commitment order will be imposed, due to non-payment and is to run consecutive to any sentence defendant may be serving at that time.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must make arrangements within the first 60 days to undergo an anger management assessment and also a psychological/mental health evaluation and follow through with any and all recommendations.

No contact with the victim except as allowed by the family court order. No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns. Defendant must not possess or consume marijuana in any jurisdiction.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Defendant must take any medication that may be prescribed by a treating physician or medical care provider and is to be taken in the manner in which it is prescribed.

records.addlTxt: 3:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tristan Samuel Alloway in court.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus in court for Tristan Samuel Alloway. Court calls 22CF65 and 21CM138. State believes there is a resolution on 21CM138 pleading g/nc to amended FCO of DC, $300 fine plus costs. 22CF65 pleading guilty to counts 1, 2, 3 & 4. Courts 5-8 DRI. Counts 1 3 - with held sentence 18 months probation, $500 plus costs. 2 and 4 - with held 18 months probation, costs only. Conditions: AODA and follow through, anger management, mental health evaluation, must follow family court order, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol or MJ, no entry into any bars or liquor stores, FT schooling/employment, 20 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by medical provider. Alloway and Cveykus agree. Court makes sure DE understands what it means to have a count DRI. Alloway understands. Court amends count 1 in 21M138 to FC Ordinance of DC. Alloway pleads no contest. Court finds guilty, imposes fine of $300 plus costs, apply bond, remainder 60 DTP/CO. On 22CF65 - State has complied with victim rights notification. Court DRI counts 5-8. Counts 1, 2, 3 and 4 - Alloway pleads guilty. Court has PLQ and goes over the form with the defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial. Court finds factual basis exists, accepts pleas of guilty and adjudges guilty of counts 1, 2, 3 and 4 as alleged with modifiers. State makes statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Cveykus makes statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Alloway makes statement, remorseful. Court considered all statements and factors, will follow joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Counts 1, 2 , 3 and 4 with hold sentence and place on probation for 18 Months. Conditions AODA and follow through with all recommendations, within 60 days make arrangements for an anger management evaluation program and follow through, make arrangements within 60 days for mental health evaluation and follow through, no contact with victim except as allowed by family court order, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no consumption or possession of marijuana in any jurisdiction, FT employment, 20 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical provider.  Counts 1 & 3 $500 plus costs and on counts 2 & 4 - court costs only - grants 60 DTP/CO. Appeal rights, DNA sample with surcharges. 2 days credit if revoked.

11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tristan Samuel Alloway in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus not in court. Court asks the defendant why he was not in Court on time this morning. Alloway responds, informs Court why he was late. Court will quash the previously issued warrant, continues bond, gives ramifications of appearing again without one, sets for AIA on 6/15/22 at 10:15 AM, make sure Attorney Cveykus knows of this new date and time, does put on the the record that the defendant did appear this morning around 9:10 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

No violent or abusive conduct with Stephanie Denton or Richard Alloway, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

12:01 PM Defendant Tristan Samuel Alloway in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Re-called from this morning. Court questions why he was not in court this morning, did not appear and a warrant was issued. Alloway apologizes got the time confused, thought it was at 11:00 AM. State - no issue with quashing warrant. Court - based on appearance, quashes warrant. Alloway has received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Alloway understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Alloway has not talked with an attorney. Court advises of option for obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire or court appointed if not eligible. Alloway understands and will be contacting a private attorney. State asks for $5000 signature bond, no violent or abusive conduct with Stephanie Denton or Richard Alloway, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Court sets bond - $5000 signature bond, no violent or abusive conduct with Stephanie Denton or Richard Alloway, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:51 AM Defendant Tristan Samuel Alloway not in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State based on failure to appear asks for warrant, body or $500, returnable nationwide. Court so orders.
